title: 107_s1129
content: PROVISIONS RELATING TO CERTAIN OFFICES AND POSITIONS WITHIN THE EXECUTIVE BRANCH. Provisions relating to executive schedule pay rates are amended to adjust annual pay rates for General Schedule employees in the District of Columbia based on comparability payments. The annual pay rates for Executive Schedule positions in the District of Columbia are adjusted based on comparability payments for General Schedule employees. The Executive Schedule pay rates in the District of Columbia are adjusted based on the percentage adjustment for General Schedule employees in the same area. If adjustments are scheduled for the same date, the General Schedule adjustment takes precedence. The annual rate of pay for General Schedule employees in the District of Columbia is adjusted based on the percentage adjustment for Executive Schedule pay rates. If adjustments are scheduled for the same date, the General Schedule adjustment takes precedence. The adjusted annual rate of pay shall be treated as such for all purposes, except as provided by law. An annual rate of pay, once adjusted, is considered the official rate for the positions involved, unless specified otherwise by law. The adjustment cannot continue after the comparability payment it was based on has ended. Additionally, amendments are made to Section 5372a of title 5, United States Code, regarding contract appeals board members. Amendments are made to Section 5372a of title 5, United States Code, for contract appeals board members, ensuring they receive no less than 97 percent and 94 percent of the official rate of pay. Amendments to Section 5372a of title 5, United States Code ensure contract appeals board members receive no less than 97 percent and 94 percent of the official rate of pay, effective at the beginning of the first applicable pay period after an adjustment in rates of basic pay under the General Schedule. Amendments to Section 5372a of title 5, United States Code ensure contract appeals board members' pay rates are adjusted in line with General Schedule changes. Amendments to Section 5372a of title 5, United States Code require adjusting contract appeals board members' pay rates in alignment with General Schedule changes. Amendments to Section 5372a of title 5, United States Code involve adjusting pay rates for contract appeals board members in alignment with General Schedule changes. The amendments include modifications to subsections and exclusions of previous adjustments. Amendments to various sections of title 5, United States Code exclude executive schedule comparability adjustments and limit certain payments. Amendments to sections of title 5, United States Code exclude executive schedule comparability adjustments and limit certain payments for specific employees receiving basic pay under certain sections. Amendments to title 5, United States Code add provisions for employees receiving basic pay under specific sections to substitute the Vice President's salary rate for the Executive Schedule level I pay. References to level IV of the Executive Schedule in various sections are also amended. Amendments to title 5, United States Code adjust references to level IV of the Executive Schedule to level III in specific sections. SEC. 2. PROVISIONS RELATING TO CERTAIN OFFICES AND POSITIONS WITHIN THE JUDICIAL BRANCH. Increase in Maximum Rates of Basic Pay Allowable for certain positions within the judicial branch under title 28, United States Code. This includes amendments to section 604(a)(5) and section 332(f)(1) to specify the maximum rate of basic pay allowed for employees. The text chunk discusses amendments to the Executive Schedule pay rates for certain positions within the judicial branch under title 28, United States Code. This includes changes to the pay rates for circuit executives and personnel of the administrative office of the United States courts. Amendments to the pay rates for certain positions within the judicial branch under title 28, United States Code are discussed. This includes changes to the pay rates for circuit executives and personnel of the administrative office of the United States courts. Amendments are made to the pay rates for certain positions within the judicial branch under title 28, United States Code. This includes changes to the pay rates for circuit executives and personnel of the administrative office of the United States courts, specifically adjusting levels IV to III in the Executive Schedule. Amendments to title 28, United States Code involve changing pay rates for certain judicial branch positions. This includes adjusting the pay levels from IV to III in the Executive Schedule for circuit executives and personnel of the administrative office of the United States courts. The amendments made by this Act will be effective for pay periods starting on or after the enactment date.
